Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: Which one of the following statements is not correct ?
options: Sounds wave in gases are longitudinal in nature
Sounds wave having frequency below 20 Hz are known as ultrasonic waves
Sounds waves having higher amplitudes are louder
Sound waves with high audible frequencies are sharp
Physics (Waves & Sound).answer: Sounds wave having frequency below 20 Hz are known as ultrasonic waves
Physics (Waves & Sound).explanation: The sound waves having frequency below 20 Hz are inaudible. Ultrasonic waves are those waves which have the frequency of above 20,000 Hz.

Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: A person rings a metallic bell near a strong concrete wall. He hears the echo after 0.3 s. if the sound moves with a speed of 340 m/s, how far is the wall from him?
Physics (Waves & Sound).explanation: Let the distance is x metre. Distance = Velocity × Time. x = 340 × 0.3 = 102 metre (This is the total distance). \ The distance of wall is 102/2 = 51 metre.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: A myopic person has a power of 1.25 dioptre, what is the focal length and nature of his lens ?
Physics (Optics).explanation: The nature of the lens used to correct myopic eye is a concave lens. \ D = 1/f(metre) = 1/D = 1/1.25 = 100/125 = 0.80 metre = 80 cm

Physics (Electromagnetism).subject: Physics (Electromagnetism)
Physics (Electromagnetism).question: Which one of the following statements about bar magnet is correct ?
options: The pole strength of the north-pole of a bar magnet is larger than that of the south-pole
When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis, the north and south pole get separated
When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis two new bar magnets are formed
The poles of a bar magnet are unequal in magnitude and opposite in nature
Physics (Electromagnetism).answer: When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis two new bar magnets are formed
Physics (Electromagnetism).explanation: If any magnet is divided into two parts, every part will be a new magnet.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The rate of change of momentum of a body equal of the resultant :
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Newton's 2nd Law - The rate of Change of momentum always acts in the direction of resultant force acting on a body Þ (F = ma) (where m = mass; a = aceeleration)

Physics (Units & Measurements).subject: Physics (Units & Measurements)
Physics (Units & Measurements).question: The SI unit of mechanical power is :
Physics (Units & Measurements).explanation: Watt is the SI unit of mechanical power.

Physics (Waves).subject: Physics (Waves)
Physics (Waves).question: Which one of the following statements is correct? The velocity of sound :
options: Does not depend upon the nature of media
is maximum in gases and minimum in liquids
is maximum in solids and minimum in liquids
is maximum in solids and minimum in gases
Physics (Waves).answer: is maximum in solids and minimum in gases
Physics (Waves).explanation: The Sound propagation is facilitated by the collisions between the particles of medium. The inter-molecular distance in solids is very small whereas in gases it is very high. Therefore the velocity of sound is maximum in solids and minimum in gases.

Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter)
Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).question: A piece of ice, 100 g in mass is kept at 0°C. The amount of heat is requires to melt at 0°C is (take latent heat of melting of ice to be 333.6 j / g) :
Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).explanation:
q = m D Hf
Where, m = mass, q = heat energy
D Hf = heat of fusion
q = (100g) × 333.6 J/g = 33360 J

Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter)
Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).question: Two systems are said to be in thermal equilibrium if and only if :
options: there can be a heat flow between them even if they are at different temperatures
there cannot be a heat flow between them even if they are at different temperatures
there is no heat flow between them
Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).answer: there is no heat flow between them
Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).explanation: Two systems are said to be in thermal equilibrium if is no heat transfer takes place as both the systems have same temperature.

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: Which one of the following is an example of chemical change?
options: Dissolution of cane sugar in water
Preparation of ice cubes from water
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation: Burning of paper is a chemical change because it is irreversible.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Which one of the following statements is not correct ?
options: Hydrogen and oxygen form an explosive mixture
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Hydrogen has three naturally occuring isotopes denoted by 1H, 2H and 3H.

Chemistry (General Concepts).subject: Chemistry (General Concepts)
Chemistry (General Concepts).question: Which one of the following statements is not correct ?
options: Atoms of different elements may have same mass numbers
Atoms of an element may have different mass numbers
All the atoms of an element have same number of protons
All the atoms of an element will always have same number of neutrons.
Chemistry (General Concepts).answer: All the atoms of an element will always have same number of neutrons.
Chemistry (General Concepts).explanation: Atoms of the same element always have the same number of protons (is it had a different number of protons it would be a different element.)

Chemistry (Polymers).subject: Chemistry (Polymers)
Chemistry (Polymers).question: The synthetic rubber has replaced natural rubber for domestic and industrial purposes. Which one of the following is the main reason behind that?
options: Natural rubber is unable to meet the growing demand of different industries
Natural rubber is grown in tropical countries only
Raw material for synthetic rubber is easily available
Chemistry (Polymers).answer: Raw material for synthetic rubber is easily available
Chemistry (Polymers).explanation: Natural rubber, coming from latex of Hevea brasiliensis containing traces of impurities like protein, dirt, etc. while synthetic rubber is made by the polymerization of a variety of petroleum-based precursors.

Chemistry (Polymers).subject: Chemistry (Polymers)
Chemistry (Polymers).question: The handle of pressure cookers is made of plastic because it should be made non-conductor of heat. The plastic used there is the first man-made plastic, which is :
Chemistry (Polymers).explanation: Bakelite was invented by Leo Baekeland in New York in 1907. It is the first man made plastic.

Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry)
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).question: Methyl lsocyanate gas, which was involved in the disaster in Bhopal in December 1984, was used in the Union Carbide factory for production of :
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).explanation: Methyl Isocyanate gas (MIC) is used in preparation of pesticides.

Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).subject: Chemistry (Materials & Alloys)
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).question: German silver is used to make decorative articles, coinage metal, ornaments, The name is given because :
options: it is an alloy of copper and contains silver as one of its components
Germans were the first to use silver
It is an alloy of silver
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).explanation: German silver is a mixture of copper, zinc and nickel. It is an alloy metal. It is used to make pots and toys due to hardness toughness and resistance to corrosion.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Plants contain a variety of sterols like stigmasterol, ergosterol, sitosterol etc. which very closely resemble cholesterol. These plant sterols are referred as:
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Phytosterols (plant sterols) are a family of molecules related to cholesterol. Structurally, these are very similar to cholesterol except that they always contain some substitutions at the C24 position on the sterol side chain.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Which one of the following vitamins has a role in blood clotting ?
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Vitamin K is essential for the functioning of several proteins involved in physiological processes that encompass, but are not limited to, the regulation of blood clotting.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Vitamin B12 deficiency causes pernicious anemia, Animals cannot synthesize vitamin B12. Humans must obtain all their vitamin B12 from their diet. The complexing metal ion in vitamin B12 is :
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Cobalt is the active centre of coenzymes called cobalamins, the most common example of which is vitamin B12.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Glucose is a source of energy. Which one of the following types of molecule is glucose ?
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Glucose is a sugar with the molecular formula C6H12O6. The suffix "-ose" is a chemical classifier, denoting a Carbohydrate.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Which one of the following hormones contains peptide chain ?
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Insulin is a peptide hormone produced by beta cells in the pancreas and by Brockmann body in some teleost fish.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Which one of the following is considered as 'good cholesterol' with reference to individuals facing the risk of cardio-vascular diseases and hypertension?
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Good Cholesterol refers to HDL (High Density Lipoprotein), Lipoproteins are complex particles composed of multiple type of proteins.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: In artificial insemination (AI) process. Which of the following is/are introduced into the uterus of the female ?
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: The Artificial Insemination (AI) is the process in which a thin, flexible tube (Catheter) is used to put sperm artificially into a woman's cervix.

Biology (Genetics).subject: Biology (Genetics)
Biology (Genetics).question:
Genetically modified (GM) crops contain modified genetic material due to :
1. introduction of new DNA
2. removal of existing DNA
3. introduction of RNA
4. introduction of new traits
Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Biology (Genetics).explanation: Introduction of new traits to the plant which does not occur naturally in the species introduction of new DNA and removal of existing DNA are the processes by which Genetically Modified crops are produced.

Biology (Genetics).subject: Biology (Genetics)
Biology (Genetics).question:
The Germplasm is required for the propagation of plants and animals, Germplasm is the :
1. genetic resources
2. seeds or tissues for breeding
3. egg and sperm repository
4. a germ cell's determining zone
Select the correct answer using the code given below
Biology (Genetics).explanation: Germplasm is a biosubstance (eg. - seeds, tissue pollen grains, sperms & eggs etc.) which is used as genetic material for animal & plant breeding for preservation and research purpose.

Biology (Cell Biology).subject: Biology (Cell Biology)
Biology (Cell Biology).question: The living content of cell is called protoplasm. It is composed of :
Biology (Cell Biology).explanation: Protoplasm is the whole content of a cell enclosed within the cell membrane, including both the cytoplasm and nucleus.

Biology (Diseases).subject: Biology (Diseases)
Biology (Diseases).question:
Which of the following pairs of vitamin and disease is / are correctly matched ?
1. Vitamin A - Rickets
2. Vitamin B1 - Beribri
3. Vitamin C - Scurvy
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
Biology (Diseases).explanation:
Vitamin A - Night blindness
Vitamin B1 - Beriberi
Vitamin C - Scurvy

Biology (Diseases).subject: Biology (Diseases)
Biology (Diseases).question:
Dengue virus is known to cause low platelet count in blood of patient by :
1. interfering in the process of platelet production in bone marrow
2. infecting endothelial cells
3. binding with platelets
4. accumulating platelets in intestine
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
Biology (Diseases).explanation: Dengue virus after infection, interferes the production of platelets in bone marrow, infects endothelial cells and bind with platelets.
